alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Dade; Dallas; Greene; Hickory; Polk (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 11:26PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN HICKORY... NORTHWESTERN DALLAS...SOUTHEASTERN CEDAR...POLK...NORTHWESTERN GREENE AND DADE COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM CDT... At 1125 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Weaubleau to near Fair Play to near Greenfield. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Bolivar, Stockton Lake, Pomme de Terre Lake, Pomme De Terre State Park, Stockton State Park, Ash Grove, Pittsburg, Greenfield, Humansville, Walnut Grove, Polk, Fair Play, Weaubleau, Urbana, Morrisville, Everton, Dadeville, Halfway, Flemington and Louisburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Dade; Dallas; Greene; Hickory; Polk
